location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed on paper.Dimensions: 660 x 1025mm, on sheet 685 x 1047mm.

mods.abstract: This map, published under the direction of Colonel Sir Sidney Gerald Burrard, Surveyor-General of India, shows the Aden Protectorate, with lines drawn in blue, yellow and red crayon. The blue crayon traces over the Anglo-Turkish boundary. The yellow line, according to pencilled notes, depicts the Imam of Yemen's [Yaḥyá Muḥammad Ḥamīd al-Dīn's] proposed line for the new boundary of the Protectorate, while the red line shows the boundary as suggested by the Assistant Political Resident at Aden, Major Trenchard Craven William Fowle.
